text: In Buddhist thought, bodhicitta is the motivation of a bodhisattva. The word bodhicitta combines the words for enlightenment (Bodhi) and mind (Citta). It is sometimes translated as mind of enlightenment. Bodhicitta is taught to be the intent to become enlightened, not for oneself, but for the benefit of all beings. Category:Buddhist terminology
title: Bodhicitta
